poem:
Title: "A Call to Valour in Politic Shades"

Oh brave Labour, answer not to gold's command.
Admit the plight of Britain's barren land.
From Rachel Reeves, a change too meagrely planned,
Doomed by that old, pernicious Tory brand.
Seek remedy bold, not tax's narrow span,
But in humanity invest, not the coffers of man.
When austerity looms, let courage expand,
In the name of all, make your grand stand.
